text: [Music]
I was exposed to this uh financial
market
short term pressure on a daily
base. Now we resist it. for example, we
still don't give quarterly profit
figures and uh we have been called
dinosaurs and and and and secret and I
don't know what and and certainly have
been punished uh sometimes by the
financial markets for not doing so. But
it was done on the absolute conviction
that if you give in and you start to
give quarterly profit figures, the
organization will start to think in
quarterly
terms because each of the figures that
you present afterwards is going to be
interpreted, is going to be
extrapolated, it's going to be discussed
and the whole organization is going to
think for at least a period of two
months. nothing but the quarterly
figures and I don't think that's good
for business. I don't think it's good
for the long-term value creation for our
shareholders. So therefore we resisted
and we went so far that we don't go to
any stock exchange where quarterly uh
reporting is being demanded. So we stay
at home. Uh now you have to be convinced
of
this and by doing so and at the same
time by
performing you will then start to
convince shareholders that this is
perhaps a different way but a very good
way for them and today we have from more
than 50% of our shareholders we are
being encouraged not to go to quarterly
profit and I think this is the result of
consistency coherency over many many
years. So it can be done. I know it's
not
easy but I think it is good for the
shareholders in the long
term. I think sometimes uh they have
been forgetting what their real roles in
society should be. I mean the real roles
in society was to be the oil of the real
economy. The real role in society was
how and were do you really put money in
order to uh foster uh certain industries
or how to assure long-term development?
I mean if I think back for example here
in Switzerland the role of the banks in
order to create the infrastructure to
build the first railway tunnels through
the elps and things like this those were
pioneering works which today have been a
little bit uh downplayed I would say in
the financial worlds and it comes rather
back to proprietary proprietary trading
or it comes more to the speculative
aspect to the hedging aspect and things
this as value creator. So I think um the
financial
world should and uh hopefully will also
look a little bit into into uh their own
role in society and perhaps amend some
of the things that have happened. But
where I agree with you, what is
sometimes more disturbing is that uh
they try uh to impose uh very very uh uh
I would
say simple-minded uh monetary vision uh
on the CEOs or on the management of the
real economy and it comes back to the
quality of the CEOs.
